results.title: Acute hepatitis associated with the use of levofloxacin.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ had a history of @<m>DISEASE_Bronchitis_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029481 @@@chronic bronchitis@@@, arterial @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@, and @DISEASE_Prostatic_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D011470 @@@benign prostatic hyperplasia@@@, and was being treated with @CHEMICAL_Salmeterol_Xinafoate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068299 @@@salmeterol@@@ 50 mug plus @CHEMICAL_Fluticasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068298 @@@fluticasone@@@ 250 mug BID, and @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 5 mg, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20 mg, @CHEMICAL_alfuzosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C047638 @@@alfuzosin@@@ 10 mg, and @CHEMICAL_Finasteride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018120 @@@finasteride@@@ 5 mg once daily.

citations.NLM: Figueira-Coelho J, Pereira O, Picado B, Mendonça P, Neves-Costa J, Neta J. Acute hepatitis associated with the use of levofloxacin. Clin Ther. 2010 Sep;32(10):1733-7. PMID: 21194596
